analysis: 76ers +2 vs Pistons. THESIS: Maxey's brilliance (32+ PPG) and Philadelphia's 9-2 ATS record offer value against Pistons missing 4 starters (Cunningham, Duren, Harris, Thompson). Line moved dramatically from -6.5 to -2 on heavy sharp action. RESULT: Process failure. Pistons won 114-105, missing cover by 7 points. This was a fundamental misread of team depth vs individual talent. Detroit's five players scored 14+ points (Green 21, Jenkins 19, Robinson 15, LeVert 14, Stewart 14) while Maxey's 31 points on 31 shots (inefficient volume) represented Philly's only offense. Philadelphia's catastrophic 15-point fourth quarter exposed one-man team limitations. Pistons' 9-game win streak reflected organizational depth and Coach Bickerstaff's defensive system, not luck. Jenkins' 52-foot buzzer-beater (cut 5-pt lead to 2) shifted momentum into 4th. Detroit had beaten PHI 111-108 five days earlier - betting them to cover +2 in Detroit after losing by 3 in Philly ignored critical recent H2H data. Sharp money collectively wrong - fading hot teams without specific reason is flawed process. Lesson: avoid one-man road teams against deep, well-coached opponents regardless of ATS records.
thesis: Taking the underdog here with a projected +12% edge. Market is overvaluing Detroit Pistons. Line movement and sharp action indicate value on Philadelphia 76ers. EV analysis shows +24.0% expected return.

analysis: Mavericks +3.5 vs Clippers. THESIS: Two injured teams create uncertainty, +3.5 offers value given Clippers' 0-9 ATS stretch (1-10 ATS season). Line moved from -4.5 to -3.5 toward Dallas on sharp money. Both teams severely depleted (DAL missing Irving, Davis, Washington; LAC missing Beal, Leonard). RESULT: Variance loss via double overtime. Game tied 114-114 in regulation, 123-123 after 1OT. Harden's historic 41-14-11 triple-double (first 40-pt triple-double in Clippers franchise history) plus second OT collapse (DAL outscored 10-4) produced 6-point Clippers win. Mavericks' third game in four nights, fatigue showed in 2OT. D'Angelo Russell's 7 turnovers (2 in final 2:20 of 2OT) killed comeback. Zubac dominated depleted frontcourt (27 pts, 73% FG). This was good process with unlucky variance - double OT added 6+ points to margin, historic Harden performance. Acceptable loss in 'two bad teams' spot.
thesis: Taking the underdog here with a projected +14% edge. Market is overvaluing LA Clippers. Line movement and sharp action indicate value on Dallas Mavericks. EV analysis shows +28.0% expected return.

analysis: Arizona -1.5 vs UCLA at neutral site (Intuit Dome). THESIS: Veteran execution beats youthful talent in close neutral-site games. Arizona's senior leadership (Dell'Orso, Bradley) would prevail against UCLA's untested roster. UCLA entered 0-3 ATS, having failed to cover against weaker opponents. Neutral site negated UCLA's Pauley Pavilion edge. Arizona's rebounding and paint dominance (34th in adjusted tempo) would overwhelm UCLA's preference for slower pace (222nd). RESULT: Perfect execution. Arizona won 69-65, covering -1.5 by exactly 2.5 points. Dell'Orso (20 pts) and Bradley (15 pts, 11 in final 5:17) combined for 35 points. Arizona dominated paint 38-20, rebounds 35-28, and bench scoring 28-3. The 20-8 closing run over final 7:17 validated veteran composure thesis. UCLA fell to 0-4 ATS. Textbook handicapping success.
thesis: Taking the favorite here with a projected +16% edge. Projection models show Arizona Wildcats should cover. Key matchup advantages and recent form support this spread. EV analysis shows +32.0% expected return.

analysis: Iowa +6.5 vs USC. THESIS: Iowa's defensive strength and USC's inconsistent road performance suggested underdog value. Iowa historically performs well as home underdog, ranking 3rd nationally in defensive efficiency. USC struggled in hostile environments this season (0-2 on the road vs ranked opponents). Line moved from +7 to +6.5 on Iowa money. RESULT: Lucky cover after complete collapse. Iowa dominated first half, leading 21-10 at halftime behind 2 TDs and strong defensive pressure. Then disaster: Iowa shut out completely in 2nd half (0 points), USC scored final 19 points. Final 26-21 USC win meant Iowa still covered +6.5 by 1.5 points. Makai Lemon (10 rec, 153 yds, TD) led USC comeback. Iowa's offense collapsed - couldn't convert possession into points despite controlling clock (30:44 vs 29:16). Right side for wrong reasons - bet on defense, won despite offense failing. Fortunate that USC couldn't push margin past 5 points. Classic 'bad process, good result' scenario.

analysis: Texas +4.5 vs Georgia at Sanford Stadium. THESIS: Texas ranked #10 with CFP hopes, expecting competitive game at hostile environment. Small spread suggested oddsmakers projected tight matchup. Texas averaging 32.1 PPG, Georgia's defense allowing 18.3 PPG - projected final in 27-24 range. RESULT: Complete blowout and total misread. Georgia dominated 35-10, missing cover by 20.5 points. Gunner Stockton absolutely shredded Texas defense (24-of-29 passing, 4 TDs, 1 INT). Georgia controlled possession 35:09 to 24:51, total yards 357-274. Georgia outscored Texas 21-0 in 4th quarter alone, turning competitive game into rout. Texas managed only 274 total yards against UGA's suffocating defense. Fundamental error: underestimated Stockton's breakout performance and Georgia's home-field dominance at Sanford Stadium (8-1 ATS at home this season). Texas's offense completely overwhelmed, couldn't establish run (89 rush yards) or pass (185 pass yards). Wrong side entirely - should have faded Texas on road against elite SEC defense.

analysis: Oklahoma +6.5 vs Alabama at Bryant-Denny Stadium. THESIS: Road underdog with elite defensive metrics (2nd nationally in turnover margin +1.4/game) facing Alabama team prone to turnovers (averaging 1.7 TO/game, 89th nationally). OU's opportunistic defense and desperate CFP hopes (needed win to stay alive) suggested major value. Alabama's recent struggles at home vs ranked opponents (1-2 ATS) indicated vulnerability. Line moved from +7.5 to +6.5 on sharp OU money. RESULT: Perfect execution, textbook win. OU forced 3 Alabama turnovers and converted into 17 points - exactly as modeled. Eli Bowen's 87-yard pick-six gave OU early 10-0 lead and momentum. Defense dominated throughout: held Alabama to 21 points, forced critical mistakes in red zone. Tate Sandell's 52-yard FG extended lead, then game-sealing 24-yard FG provided insurance. John Mateer's 20-yard rushing TD and Daniel Hill's 1-yard TD run for Alabama rounded out scoring. Final 23-21 OU victory covered +6.5 comfortably. Alabama couldn't overcome turnover battle at home despite Bryant-Denny advantage. Excellent handicap of turnover-prone Alabama vs ball-hawking OU secondary. This validated thesis: elite defenses with CFP motivation destroy turnover-prone teams. Best bet of the day.

Missed by 5.5 receptions - catastrophic beat. Eagles defense dominated to extent that Lions managed only 9 points total. Fundamental misread of Eagles defensive dominance.

analysis: Jalen Hurts OVER 30.5 Rushing Yards. THESIS: Hurts averaging 42.3 rush YPG this season, mobile QB who uses legs to extend plays and move chains. Lions defense allowing 4.8 YPC to QBs. Sunday Night Football stage with Hurts motivated against fellow elite team. Expected designed runs plus scrambles to hit 35-40 yards. RESULT: Narrow cover by 0.5 yards. Hurts rushed 10 times for exactly 31 yards, clearing 30.5 by just 0.5 yards. Game was defensive slugfest (Eagles won 16-9), limiting overall offensive production. Hurts passed for only 135 yards (14-of-28) as Eagles leaned on run game and defense. His lone TD came on 1-yard QB sneak with 16 seconds left in first half.
